definitions.definition: The desire for wealth personified as an evil spirit or a malign influence.
Often mammon: wealth, material avarice, profit.
Able to be discovered.
Subject to legal discovery; able to be requested by an opposing party through a legal process such as a subpoena.
Of, pertaining to, or arising from atrophy
A sibilant buzz or vibration; the sound of something in rapid motion.
A bustle of noise and excitement.
To move or vibrate (something) with a buzzing sound.
To make a sibilant buzzing or droning sound.
To cause (something) to make such a sound.
An ingredient that is intentionally added to a drug for purposes other than the therapeutic or diagnostic effect at the intended dosage.
An exceptor.
An evacuated glass bulb containing a metal filament which is heated by electrical resistance to produce light.
(by extension) An article that resembles such a bulb and converts electricity to light by any process.
definitions.example: a fluorescent light bulb

definitions.definition: Used in reference to the sudden arrival of a realization, an inspiration, an idea, or the like.
definitions.example: a light bulb moment

definitions.definition: An uninvited third person joining a couple's date who prevents or hinders romantic interactions.
Henna (substance used for colouring)
To remove tangles or knots from.
definitions.example: With gentle combing, untangle your hair.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To remove confusion or mystery from.
definitions.example: It took a while, but he finally untangled the problem.

definitions.definition: To cause (someone) pain, suffering or distress.
To strike or cast down; to overthrow.
To make low or humble.
An affliction.
The writer of a biography
Having a thin coating of the metal silver applied to it.
definitions.example: The spoon looked like sterling, but actually it was cheap silver-plated steel.

definitions.definition: A cassette designed to hold recorded sound or music.
A building or other structure containing a (large) wheel, such as the water wheel of a mill.

A prehistoric structure from the Iron Age found in Scotland, characteristically including an outer wall within which a circle of stone piers (resembling the spokes of a wheel) form the basis for lintel arches supporting corbelled roofing with a hearth at the hub.
(by extension from sense 1.2) A pitch location which is favourable to the hitter.
definitions.example: The pitch was right in his wheelhouse, and he hit a grand slam.

definitions.definition: A person's area of authority or expertise.
definitions.example: Horse viruses are in Pat’s wheelhouse.

definitions.definition: Any plant of the clade Angiosperms, characterized by having ovules enclosed in an ovary; a flowering plant.
A lymphocyte, produced in the thymus, that develops into a T cell
To have or express an opinion; to state as an opinion; to suppose, consider (that).
definitions.example: "Your decisions," she opined, "have been unfailingly disastrous for this company."

definitions.definition: To give one's formal opinion (on or upon something).
definitions.example: I had to opine on the situation because I thought a different perspective was in order.

definitions.definition: Dried leaves of an Asian species of mugwort, Artemisia argyi as used in moxibustion.
Any other plant used in moxibustion.
A person who kidnaps someone.
Any bulbous plant of the genus Hyacinthus, native to the Mediterranean and South Africa.
A variety of zircon, ranging in color from brown, orange, reddish-brown and yellow; a jacinth.
A work of art or other image depicting sky and clouds.
To refill a hole with the material dug out of it.
To refill an excavation unit to restore the former ground surface and/or to preserve the unit and make it recognizable as having been excavated.
To provide reserve support.
To replenish or restock due to attrition or loss.
definitions.example: The company backfilled Joe's position after he was terminated.

definitions.definition: The process by which something is backfilled.
definitions.example: the backfilling of trenches

definitions.definition: One hundredth of the former German mark (Deutsche Mark).
One who rustles; a cattle (or other livestock) thief.
A bovine animal that can care for itself in any circumstances.
(Western US) An alert, energetic, driving person.
That which makes a rustling noise.
A structure of wood or stone extended into the sea to influence the current or tide, or to protect a harbor or beach.
A wharf or dock extending from the shore.
A part of a building that jets or projects beyond the rest, and overhangs the wall below.
Treating serious issues with (often deliberately) inappropriate humour; flippant.
definitions.example: Robbie's joke about Heather's appearance was just him being facetious.

definitions.definition: Pleasantly humorous; jocular.
A light metallic sound, resembling the tinkling of bells or wind chimes.
A telephone call.
definitions.example: Give me a tinkle when you arrive.

definitions.definition: An act of urination.
To make light metallic sounds, rather like a very small bell.
definitions.example: The glasses tinkled together as they were placed on the table.

definitions.definition: To cause to tinkle.
To indicate, signal, etc. by tinkling.
definitions.example: The butler tinkled dinner.

definitions.definition: To hear, or resound with, a small, sharp sound.
To urinate.
To make (one's way) with a crawling motion.
definitions.example: We wormed our way through the underbrush.

definitions.definition: To move with one's body dragging the ground.
To work one's way by artful or devious means.
To work (one's way or oneself) (into) gradually or slowly; to insinuate.
definitions.example: He wormed his way into the organization

definitions.definition: To effect, remove, drive, draw, or the like, by slow and secret means; often followed by out.
(in “worm out of”) To drag out of, to get information that someone is reluctant or unwilling to give (through artful or devious means or by pleading or asking repeatedly).
To fill in the contlines of (a rope) before parcelling and serving.
definitions.example: Worm and parcel with the lay; turn and serve the other way.

definitions.definition: To deworm (an animal).
To cut the worm, or lytta, from under the tongue of (a dog, etc.) for the purpose of checking a disposition to gnaw, and formerly supposed to guard against canine madness.
To clean by means of a worm; to draw a wad or cartridge from, as a firearm.
Affected with woodworm.
Infested with parasitic worms.
Any of a group of enzymes that catalyze the binding of two molecules; synthetase.
A globular multifunctional protein with antimicrobial activity, found in milk and many mucosal secretions such as tears and saliva
To talk foolishly; to blather
Incoherent or foolish talk.
definitions.example: the blitherings of a madman

definitions.definition: Talking incoherently; jabbering.
A vessel or fixture for washing, particularly:
Handwashing, particularly
A liquid used in washing; a lotion; a wash; a rinse.
A washroom: a room used for washing the face and hands.
A room containing a toilet: a bathroom (US) or WC (UK).
A plumbing fixture for urination and defecation: a toilet.
A place to wash clothes: a laundry.
A place where gold is panned.
A paved room in a mortuary where corpses are kept under a shower of disinfecting fluid.
(usually in the plural) A magic mushroom: a hallucinogenic fungus.
Any mushroom.
Any of the blue-green fungi, of the genus Penicillium, that are used in the manufacture of cheeses, and are an important source of antibiotics.
To devour something greedily, gorge, glut.
To feed ravenously.
To fill excessively with a body liquid, especially blood.
Overly filled with fluid; used especially of blood vessels.
A contract killer; especially one paid by mafia.
Goalscorer, someone who scores goals.
A tropical shrub with bright orange-red flowers
Not hurt; unharmed or unscathed
Redundant use of words, a pleonasm, an unnecessary and tedious repetition.
definitions.example: It is tautology to say, "Forward Planning".

definitions.definition: An expression that features tautology.
In propositional logic: a statement that is true for all truth values of its propositional variables. In first-order logic: a statement that is true for all truth values of its Boolean atoms.
Unwillingness or inability to believe; doubt about the truth or verisimilitude of something; disbelief.
Religious disbelief, lack of faith.
A polymeric macromolecule composed of many nucleotides; examples include DNA and RNA
A small donkey
Not subject to being taxed.
definitions.example: During August, clothes costing less than $75 are untaxed, to try to help the poor to buy clothes and the merchants to make money.

definitions.definition: Not having had the required taxes paid on it.
definitions.example: Bootleggers make good money selling untaxed cigarettes, until they are caught.

definitions.definition: Not tired or strained, working well within capacity.
definitions.example: The motor was untaxed by the steep hill because the vehicle was so lightly loaded.

definitions.definition: The action of yawning; opening the mouth widely and taking a long, rather deep breath, often because one is tired or bored.
A particularly boring event.
definitions.example: The slideshow we sat through was such a yawn. I was glad when it finished.

definitions.definition: To open the mouth widely and take a long, rather deep breath, often because one is tired or bored, and sometimes accompanied by pandiculation.
definitions.example: I could see my students yawning, so I knew the lesson was boring them.

definitions.definition: To say while yawning.
To present a wide opening.
definitions.example: Death yawned before us, and I hit the brakes.

definitions.definition: To open the mouth, or to gape, through surprise or bewilderment.
To be eager; to desire to swallow anything; to express desire by yawning.
definitions.example: to yawn for fat livings

definitions.definition: A narrow, tightly-coiled tube connecting the efferent ducts from the rear of each testicle to its vas deferens, where sperm are stored during maturation.
A layer of material sandwiched between others, especially a layer of plastic between the layers of laminated glass.
To layer among each other; to produce alternating layers of.
Situated between layers.
To stain with or as if with menses.
To undergo menstruation, to have a period.
A downhill trail.
The field of play of a fencing match.
The track left by somebody riding a horse.
(of a person or animal) Unable to distinguish between two or more primary colors (usually red and green).
(of a person or process) Holding no prejudice based on skin color or race; not paying attention to skin color.
The party owed an obligation by another party, the obligor.
Of, relating to, or derived from instinct.
A prohibition.
(history) Decree of condemnation toward one or more persons, especially in the Roman antiquity.
The act of proscribing, or its result.
A decree or law that prohibits.
To predict; to tell (the future) before it occurs; to prophesy.
To tell (a person) of the future.
A hidden supply or fund.
definitions.example: a hoard of provisions; a hoard of money

definitions.definition: A cache of valuable objects or artefacts; a trove.
A hoarding (temporary structure used during construction).
A hoarding (billboard).
To amass, usually for one's own private collection.
A bird, or species of birds, that is found near the edge of bodies of water.
To cry or sob softly and intermittently.
definitions.example: The lonely puppy began to whimper as soon as we left the room.

definitions.definition: To cry with a low, whining, broken voice; to whine; to complain.
To say something in a whimpering manner.
definitions.example: "Master, please don't punish me!" he whimpered.

definitions.definition: To add color to.
definitions.example: The child colorized the drawing.

definitions.definition: To convert black and white media to color by digital post production (as is often done in digital photography and in video special effects).
definitions.example: There is a colorized version of Casablanca.

definitions.definition: Methodical and efficient, in a way that would be advantageous to a business or businessperson.
Earnest and practical without being distracted or enthusiastic.
A measure of the strength of an explosion or a bomb based on how many million tons of TNT would be needed to produce the same energy.
The mane of an animal.
A loose panicle whose axis falls to pieces, as in certain grasses.
An American dance of West African origin that involves stomping as well as slapping and patting the arms, legs, chest, and cheeks.
A strip of pleated fabric or paper used as decoration or trim.
A substance or material on the edge of something, resembling such a strip of fabric.
A wrinkled edge to a film.
Something extraneous or not essential; something purely for show or effect; a luxury.
The relatively extensive margin seen on the back of the heads of reptiles, with either a bony support or a cartilaginous one.
To make into a frill.
To become wrinkled.
To provide or decorate with a frill or frills; to turn back in crimped plaits.
To shake or shiver as with cold (with reference to a hawk).
To cry (with reference to a bird of prey).
The top part of a boot or shoe, above the sole and welt and in front of the ankle seam, that covers the instep and toes; the front part of an upper; the analogous part of a stocking.
Something added to give an old thing a new appearance.
Something patched up, pieced together, improvised, or refurbished.

A repeated and often improvised accompaniment, usually consisting of one or two measures, often a single chord or simple chord progression, repeated as necessary, for example, to accommodate dialogue or to anticipate the entrance of a soloist.
(by extension) An activity or speech intended to fill or stall for time.
A flirtatious, seductive woman, especially one who exploits men by using their sexual desire for her.
A vampire.
A volunteer firefighter.
To patch, repair, or refurbish.
Often as vamp up: to fabricate or put together (something) from existing material, or by adding new material to something existing.
To cobble together, to extemporize, to improvise.
(shoemaking) To attach a vamp (to footwear).
To travel by foot; to walk.
To delay or stall for time, as for an audience.
definitions.example: Keep vamping! Something’s wrong with the mic!

definitions.definition: To seduce or exploit someone.
A geological event in which viscous mud flows down an incline.
A mixed drink consisting of vodka, Kahlua and Bailey's.
A member of the community of Internet users.
A diacritic (mark).
Capable of distinguishing or of making a distinction.
Of, pertaining to, or serving as a diacritic
A sheet of plastic embedded with microscopic crystals of herapathite or similarly acting material, so that light passing through it is polarised.
(in the plural) Spectacles made with lenses of polaroid, once used to view certain 3-D movies.
(in the plural) Polaroid sunglasses.
A camera that develops its own film.
A print from such a camera.
To photograph with a polaroid camera.
To make something mobile.
To assemble troops and their equipment in a coordinated fashion so as to be ready for war.
To become made ready for war.
The side facing land.
Located, facing or moving in the direction of the land, as opposed to the sea.
Of the country as opposed to the city, rural; agricultural.
Toward the land.
A Japanese high-speed passenger train; bullet train.
(sometimes offensive) a person who has severely impaired physical abilities because of deformation, injury, or amputation of parts of the body.
definitions.example: He returned from war a cripple.

definitions.definition: A shortened wooden stud or brace used to construct the portion of a wall above a door or above and below a window.
Scrapple.
(among lumbermen) A rocky shallow in a stream.
In an amusing manner.
A horizontal architectural element of a building, projecting forward from the main walls, originally used as a means of directing rainwater away from the building's walls.
A decorative element applied at the topmost part of the wall of a room, as with a crown molding.
A decorative element at the topmost portion of certain pieces of furniture, as with a highboy.
(mountaineering) An overhanging edge of snow on a ridge or the crest of a mountain and along the sides of gullies.
Of ostentation.
Intended to attract notice.
Of tawdry display; kitsch.
An act of renouncing.
Pertaining to (the dimension of) space.
Pertaining to (outer) space.
A toxic crystalline compound obtained from the bark of the yohimbe tree, used as an adrenergic blocking agent and also as an aphrodisiac in the treatment of impotence.
To work as a temporary employee.
A wig of false hair worn to cover a bald spot, especially as worn by a man.
A little tuft; a curl or artificial lock of hair.
A small wig, or a toppiece of a wig.
To put (something) into a pocket.
To cause a ball to go into one of the pockets of the table; to complete a shot.
To take and keep (something, especially money that is not one's own).
definitions.example: Record executives pocketed most of the young singer's earnings.

definitions.definition: To shoplift; to steal.
definitions.example: The thief was caught on camera pocketing the diamond.

definitions.definition: To put up with; to bear without complaint.
Material used for making pockets for clothing.
A structure resembling a pocket or pouch.
Pertaining to, containing, or obtained from tannin.
To write (something) using a pencil.
definitions.example: I penciled (BrE: pencilled) a brief reminder in my notebook.

definitions.definition: To mark with, or as if with, a pencil.
The middle section of something.
The midriff; the section of the human torso, from below the chest to above the waist.
A devotional piece of music sung responsively.
A response or reply.
To reverse or change the order of (two or more things); to swap or interchange.
To rewrite or perform (a piece) in another key.
To move (a term) from one side of an algebraic equation to the other, reversing the sign of the term.
To rearrange elements in a matrix, by interchanging their respective row and column positional indicators.
(chiefly of the European Union) To give force to a directive by passing appropriate implementation measures.
A transposition.
A musical instrument that is written in a different pitch to how it sounds, often for ease of playing multiple instruments of the same family that have different ranges.
definitions.example: Trumpet is a transposing instrument while trombone is not.

definitions.definition: Rifampin
Having multiple colors.
To change the route taken by something.
definitions.example: We'll have to reroute some buses to avoid the construction work.

definitions.definition: To test again.
The Eurasian blackbird, Turdus merula.
Any blackbird.
A type of mottled colouration on dogs.
A purplish-red garnet.
Subdural hematoma.
Located beneath the dura mater and above the arachnoid mater
(furniture) the flat, horizontal surface of a table
A fixed item resembling a table, used for performing skateboarding tricks.
A photograph of an object or product placed on a table.
A vertical pipe or conduit that carries rainwater from the scupper, guttering of a building to a lower roof level, drain, ground or storm water runoff system.
To give formal consent to; make officially valid, sign off on.
A vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.
To clean (a room, etc.) with a vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.
definitions.example: I need to hoover this room.

definitions.definition: To use a vacuum cleaner, irrespective of brand.
definitions.example: My husband is upstairs, hoovering.

definitions.definition: To suck in or inhale, as if by a vacuum cleaner.
A large triangular bone at the base of the spine, located between the two ilia (wings of the pelvis) and formed from vertebrae that fuse in adulthood.
To give a theme to.
definitions.example: We themed the birthday party around superheroes.

definitions.definition: To apply a theme to; to change the visual appearance and/or layout of (software).
